components.description:
The face of a horse, generally facing left. Depicted as a light or reddish-brown horse with a dark brown or black mane, and, on many platforms, a light-colored muzzle.

Not to be confused with the full-bodied üêé Horse or üèá Horse Racing, though their applications may overlap. Some vendors implement a similar design in ü¶Ñ Unicorn Face and ü¶ì Zebra.

WhatsApp’s horse is facing left, as Facebook’s previously was. Microsoft’s horse was previously looking straight ahead, as was Samsung’s, shown with a goofy, full-toothed grin. Softbank previously featured a full-bodied horse.

title: Horse Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.
